intro: Hubera senjiana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, often with a velvety texture. Hubera senjiana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 1,500 meters.
